subject: Productivity
title: Habit Stacking for Momentum
description: One-minute skill: Habit Stacking for Momentum.

hook.text: BJ Fogg built a pushup habit by doing two pushups after every bathroom visit. He now does 70 a day.

buildup.text: Habit stacking links a new behavior to an existing habit. After I do X, I will do Y.

discovery.text: The existing habit serves as the cue. No willpower needed. The behavior rides the momentum of what's already automatic.

twist.text: Starting tiny is the secret. Fogg's Tiny Habits method says: make it so small you can't say no.

climax.text: Motivation to start fades. But a tiny habit doesn't need motivation. It just needs a trigger.

punchline.text: Make it tiny. Stack it on a habit. Motivation becomes optional.

quiz.question: What is the core principle of habit stacking?
options: Linking a new behavior to an existing automatic habit
Doing the same activity repeatedly for hours
Replacing all bad habits at once
